Kyle Walker finally breaks silence amid Tottenham exit rumours

It’s safe to say we haven’t heard much from Kyle Walker in recent weeks.

The defender has been linked with a £40 million move to Manchester City after losing his place in the Tottenham starting line-up to Kieran Trippier.

Many believe Walker has had his head turned and will leave Spurs this summer. But the right-back finally broke his silence on Tuesday via social media.

He released a video tribute to White Hart Lane on his Twitter account. You can watch it below.

Walker appears to have a genuine connection to the club, and it’s worth remembering he has given many years of excellent service to Tottenham.

Whether he will still be a Spurs player come next season is still up for debate.

Moussa Sissoko: Tottenham flop could make Barcelona move

Spanish media outlet Don Balon say Spurs are looking to offload the French flop.

It's suggested that despite his disappointing season in north London, he's still highly regarded by Europe's elite.

The news that Barca are now in the hunt could frustrate rivals Real Madrid.

Mauricio Pochettino says he'll be in charge of Tottenham next season & that he has no buy-out clause in his contract.

He said;

"There is no buy-out clause in my contract, I will stay here next season. There are many rumours. I am committed with the club, no reason to leave the club. I will be here for pre-season.”
